result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner Lee Gjerdahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tanner Lee Gjerdahl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tanner Lee Gjerdahl was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/16/22 by 11:15 AM
- 8 days credit against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

10:02 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Tanner Lee Gjerdahl. Defendant Tanner Lee Gjerdahl in court. Court reviews case. Atty Chapman makes sentencing arguments. DE makes statements. Court removes JT. 

Court Orders:
    Count 1: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 180 days condition time. to commence on 10/14/22 by 04:30 PM. DE to be released on 10/17/22. Remaining Jail time to be stayed.
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- 8 days credit against ultimate sentence

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Participate in Domestic Violence Court
- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Psychological/psychiatric evaluation within 30 days and follow through with any recommended treatment, if Agent requests
-  Domestic Violence Assessment (evidence based) within 30 days and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program, if Agent requests
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Contact with Taylor R.O.
- Maintain employment
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 09/16/22 by 11:15 AM

Adjourned 10:31 AM
Probation review hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Probation review hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

04:01 PM  CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court w/Defendant Tanner Lee Gjerdahl.  Atty Chapman recites agreement addressing the habitual criminality. Atty Ballo states victims rights have been complied with. Victim asks questions. DE makes statements. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct 1. Court notes there is an agreement as to domestic abuse enhancer, habitual criminality. Upon Motion of the State, Court reads in and dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Victim makes statements. Atty Chapman makes statements, DE may want to withdraw guilty plea. Court halts proceedings. Resets mater. Adjourned: 4:36 pm.

11:02 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner Lee Gjerdahl appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Tanner Lee Gjerdahl. Victim appeared by video via Zoom. Court reviews file. ADA Smestad calls Officer Charles Welbourn of Hudson PD to testify. S/T Officer Welbourn. Direct by ADA Smestad. Exhibit #1 and Exhibit #2; O/R. Cross by Atty Chapman. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court addresses bond modification. ADA Smestad states JSC hasn't rec'd anything regarding Defendant's testing. Atty Chapman requests to take up no contact first. Victim requests to lift no contact and makes statements. Atty Chapman gives argument. ADA Smestad takes no position regarding contact with victim. Court questions attys. Court will not amend no contact, but may reconsider if DE completes a VW assessment. Atty Chapman states DE will be picking up SCRAM. Tina from JSC states nothing has been received from Montevideo PD. Court will not modify testing. Court removes Victim from Zoom due to behavior. Court sets Arraignment in person- notice will not be mailed to DE, as hearing is set for tomorrow. Adjourned at 11:24 AM.  gll
Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on July 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:07 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner Lee Gjerdahl appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Tanner Lee Gjerdahl. Victim appeared by video via Zoom. Court reviews file and notes today's hearing was calendared for STC, not a Preliminary Hearing. Court sets Preliminary Hearing and will allow Defendant to appear by Zoom. Victim asks question regarding contact in bond. Court reviews file and notes nothing filed regarding modification. Victim states she filed victim's bond modification with Victim Witness Office. Atty Chapman states this was addressed at last hearing and DA Anderson objected. Atty Chapman states contact with victim was raised orally at last hearing. Court will address at next hearing. DE states he doesn't currently have transportation, but DE has been testing at Monte Video Sheriff's Office by PBT. Court states testing at Sheriff's Office is sufficient and DE doesn't need to report to JSC, as long as JSC has appropriate release of information. Tina from JSC states PBT is instantaneous, but requests UA tests. DE will see if UAs are available at Sheriff's Office. Adjourned at 11:23 AM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Bail modification. Filed by DE. arc     Per EFV, scheduled hearing on 07/06/22. arc
for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Bail modification. Filed by DE. arc  Per EFV, Scheduled hearing on 07/06 at 2:15 PM. DE posted bond on 07/07/22. arc

** AMENDED** 

- Defendant to test today.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.M.R.O..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
